# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(s)
    wrapped = ""
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word * " "
        else
            current_line *= word * " "
        end
    end

    wrapped *= strip(current_line)
    return wrapped
end

# Usage example
println(wrap_string("This is a simple example of text wrapping done in Julia", 10))
```

In this example, any line exceeding a width of 10 characters will be moved to the next line.
